_comment: Created by NCODowd on 24/05/2016 16:31:59 using v2.7
title: Did people feel they were listened to carefully?
analysis_commentary: In 2015, 93% of people who used NHS mental health services felt they had been carefully listened to. However, the proportion of people who felt they were not listened to has more than doubled over the last number of years, from 3% in 2010 to 6.5% in 2015. It should be noted that the way in which the questioned was posed did change in 2014 to be slightly broader.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Community Mental Health Survey
